Package ui.pages.dockedpages

Class InventoryFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.base.DockedPageView
      • ui.pages.dockedpages.InventoryFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, InventoryListener, JPanelCardSlotContainer
    public class InventoryFrame
extends DockedPageView
implements InventoryListener
    The `InventoryFrame` class in Java extends `DockedPageView` and implements `InventoryListener`, providing functionality for managing inventory items through a GUI interface.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class ui.base.DockedPageView

        appPageManager, workspaceScreen, workspaceScreenLayoutManager

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      InventoryFrame()
      The `InventoryFrame` constructor initializes the `InventoryFrame` object with a default size and close operation, and creates a new `InventoryTableModel` and `JTable` for displaying inventory items.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void makePage()
      The `makePage` method sets the layout of the workspace screen to a `BorderLayout` and adds a `JScrollPane` containing the inventory table to the center of the screen.
      void onInventoryDataChanged()
      The `onDataChanged` function refreshes a table and prints "REFRESHED!!!" to the console.
      void run()
      THE `RUN` METHOD OVERRIDES THE DEFAULT BEHAVIOR TO CALL THE `MAKEPAGE` METHOD.
      void setInventoryService​(InventoryService inventoryService)
      The `setInventoryService` method sets the `inventoryService` for the `InventoryFrame` and adds the frame as a listener to the service.

      • Methods inherited from class ui.base.DockedPageView

        getPage, setAppPageManager, setWorkspaceScreenLayoutManager

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • InventoryFrame

        public InventoryFrame()
        The `InventoryFrame` constructor initializes the `InventoryFrame` object with a default size and close operation, and creates a new `InventoryTableModel` and `JTable` for displaying inventory items.

    • Method Detail

      • makePage

        public void makePage()
        The `makePage` method sets the layout of the workspace screen to a `BorderLayout` and adds a `JScrollPane` containing the inventory table to the center of the screen. It also creates buttons for adding, editing, and deleting inventory items and adds them to a panel at the bottom of the screen. The method then adds action listeners to the buttons for handling user interactions.
        Specified by:
        makePage in interface JPanelCardSlotContainer
        Specified by:
        makePage in class DockedPageView

      • setInventoryService

        public void setInventoryService​(InventoryService inventoryService)
        The `setInventoryService` method sets the `inventoryService` for the `InventoryFrame` and adds the frame as a listener to the service.
        Parameters:
        inventoryService - The `inventoryService` parameter is an `InventoryService` object that provides access to inventory data and operations.

      • onInventoryDataChanged

        public void onInventoryDataChanged()
        The `onDataChanged` function refreshes a table and prints "REFRESHED!!!" to the console.
        Specified by:
        onInventoryDataChanged in interface InventoryListener

      • run

        public void run()
        THE `RUN` METHOD OVERRIDES THE DEFAULT BEHAVIOR TO CALL THE `MAKEPAGE` METHOD.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class DockedPageView
